article:
'Prakrti' or 'Prakriti' or 'Prakruti' (from Sanskrit language à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤à¥à¤¤à¤¿, praká¹ti)
means "nature". Esoteric anatomy: the body as consciousness By Bruce Burger,
(North Atlantic Books : 1998) Page 168 It is, according to Hinduism, the
basic nature of intelligence by which the Universe exists and functions. It is
described in [[Bhagavad Gita]] as the "primal motive force". It is the essential
constituent of the universe and is at the basis of all the activity of the
creation. Maharishi Mahesh Yogi on the Bhagavad-Gita, a New Translation and
Commentary, Chapter 1-6. Penguin Books, 1969, p. 220 The one god mentioned
in the Veda has two main part Prakrti and Purush and all gods which Hindus
worship are just an instance of the Purush while goddess are instances Prakrti
(sometimes called Adi-Shakti). According to Samkhya and Bhagavad Gita Prakrti or
Nature is composed of the three gunas which are tendencies or modes of
operation, known as sattva (creation), rajas (preservation), and tamas,
(destruction) Autobiography Of A Yogi, Paramahansa Yogananda, Self
Realization Fellowship, 1973, p.22 Sattva encompasses qualities of
goodness, light, and harmony. http://books.google.com/books?id=a-Oh_-
rK5SQC&pg=PA221&dq=prakriti&lr=&ei=v3_zSdPwI4W-NsqwscEJ&hl=En The Bhagavad Gita,
Eknath Easwaran, P.221., 2007. According to the Yoga Vasistha, people who
are of a sattvic nature and whose activities are mainly based on sattva, will
tend to seek answers regarding the origin and truth of material life. With
proper support they are likely to reach liberation. The Concise Yoga
VÄsiá¹£á¹­ha, Swami Venkatesananda, 1984, p.161 Rajas is associated with
concepts of energy, activity, ambition, and passion; so that, depending on how
it is used, it can either have a supportive or hindering effect on the evolution
of the soul. http://books.google.com/books?id=a-Oh_-
rK5SQC&pg=PA221&dq=prakriti&lr=&ei=v3_zSdPwI4W-NsqwscEJ&hl=En The Bhagavad Gita,
Eknath Easwaran, P.221., 2007. Tamas is commonly associated with inertia,
darkness, insensitivity. id Souls who are more tamasic are considered
imbued in darkness and take the longest to reach liberation. The Concise
Yoga VÄsiá¹£á¹­ha, Swami Venkatesananda, 1984, p.94 Prakriti is closely
associated with the concept of Maya within Vedic scripture. http://books.go-
ogle.com/books?id=rAorcEA7j4QC&pg=PA40&dq=Prakriti++maia&lr=&ei=vdbwSY_oNor0ygT-
sq_ieCw Preceptos de PerfecciÃ³n, DiscÃ­pulos de Ramakrishna, p 40.

Mulaprakruti can be translated as "the root of nature" or "root of Prakruti"; http://books.google.com/books?id=-
LNkFPM_Xr8C&pg=PA30&dq=mulaprakriti&ei=7or3SY3qGI6gMt7wwY8E The Physics of the
Secret Doctrine, William Kingsland, 1996, p. 39 it is a closer definition
of 'fundamental matter'; and is often defined as the essence of matter, that
aspect of the Absolute which underlines all the objective aspects of Nature. http://books.google.com/books?id=3pwHAROOAIIC&pg=PA287&dq=mulaprakriti&lr=&as-
_brr=1&ei=VZD3Sa6MFpPMNZn8xNkD '' Systematic Studies in the "Secret Doctrine",
The theosophical quarterly, 1906, p.287 While plain Prakruti encompasses
classical earth element, i.e. solid matter, Mulaprakruti includes any and all
classical elements, including any considered not discovered yet (some tattvas.)-
http://books.google.com/books?id=S3BXsFJ5aZYC&pg=PA364&dq=Mulaprakriti&ei=-
iKTwSePIGomqMr70nccJ Thinking and Destiny, Harold W. Percival, 2002, p.364

Devi prakruti [[shakti]] in the context of shaktis as forces unifies kundalini,
kriya, itcha, para, jnana, mantrika shaktis. Each is in a chakra. http://bo-
oks.google.com/books?id=Gg8fAAAAIAAJ&dq=Devi+Prakriti++unify+chakra.&lr=&ei=UST-
xSdjPMJbyygSfmKSpCw Ananda lahari: The blissful wave of Sri Sankaracharya,
Åaá¹karÄcÄrya, Sivananda, Boris Sacharow, 1949 (page unavailable).

Prakruti also means nature. http://books.google.com/books?id=CJFdkkGSV8gC&p-
g=PA110&dq=Prakriti+means+nature&lr=&ei=JDvxSY2cNp6GyAT1q4yfCw River of love in
an age of pollution, David L. Haberman, 2006, p.110. Nature can be
described as environment. http://books.google.com/books?id=1UhuAAAAMAAJ&q=N-
ature+means+environment+prakriti&dq=Nature+means+environment+prakriti&lr=&ei=GT-
3xSZ-4FIXGzASWloz8Cg&pgis=1 Life and Times of Netaji Subhas: The seeds of a
Vedantic revolutionary, Adwaita P. Ganguly, 2000, P. 91. It can also be
used to denote the 'feminine' in sense of the 'male' being the purusha. Prakriti
also means health in Marathi.

According to the ancient vedic science of Ayurveda, the three gunas (sattva,
rajas and tamas) as they pertain to the human physiology are called doshas:
kapha, pitta, vata. http://books.google.com/books?id=gtUzXzASJ9oC&pg=PA66&d-
q=gunas+doshas:+kapha,+pitta,+vata&lr=&ei=sT7xSbfMMIeyyQSAwZ2JCw&client=firefox-
a Encyclopaedia of Indian Medicine, Parameshvara, S.R. Sudarshan, Saligrama
Krishna, 1999, P.66. The balance or imbalance of these doshas defines the
prakriti or nature of one's body. http://books.google.com/books?id=I8P2eq6Y-
GPkC&pg=PT47&dq=doshas+define+prakriti&ei=_j_xScbMKIiCzATWo626Dw&client=firefox-
a The essential guide to holistic and complementary therapy, Helen Beckman,
2005, p.35
